content.description: Same start as for S.I.N. trends right after the first hueco and takes the prow line for sustained thuggy movement to a hard sequence befor the finish jug, easy topout. I dont know if this has been done before so please correct on FA or Grade.
content.location: Same start as for S.I.N. trends right after the first hueco and takes the prow line.

content.description:
One of the best moderates anywhere and one of the best lines in the Tablelands - featuring fun dynamic moves with a steep, explosive start and an exciting finish.  This boulder problem embodies quality movement, and is an undisputed area classic that should be at the top of your to-do list.

Sit-start on the large obvious twin-hueco underclings.  Make a big move straight up to the gaping hueco, then style your way up and left to the good right-facing edges that lead to the rest on the good jug/sidepull.  A couple large moves up and left between crimps on the lip will get it done.
content.protection: Pads, good spot for the top-out
content.location: On the large overhanging face next to the trail (east side), look for the huecos down low on the right side of the overhang.

content.description:
A variation start to 'Strength in Numbers', bumping it up a grade.  Not quite as classic as the twin undercling start, but it's still a great line.

Start low on pockets to the right and around the corner of the start to 'Strength in Numbers'.  Work up and make the big reach left to the large hueco, bypassing the beginning twin underclings.  Finish as 'Strength in Numbers'.
content.location: Just right of the start to 'Strength in Numbers', around the corner.

content.description:
Sit start on the right side of the boulder with hands in good pockets.   Pull on then move left along a line of crimps.   At the end of the traverse move up via a pinch to a tennis ball size hueco.

From the hueco make long moves to some slopers, and move on passed these to better holds and the top.

Start on the twin underclings of 'Strength in Numbers', move up to the big hueco, up and left to the right-facing flake holds.  Then, INSTEAD of going up and left to the crimp, move out right on the face using bad holds.  Scum your way to the top using whatever you can find...

Sit start at the right with hands in good pockets.

Pull on and pass a small hole before a big move gains a large hole.   From here finish more or less directly up.
